content.title: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Best Public Sector Organisation In Promoting The Wellbeing And Welfare Of Senior Citizens
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Every year, the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India confers the 'National Award for Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman)' to the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st October every year by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. The 'Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best Private Sector Organisation in Promoting the Wellbeing and Welfare of Senior Citizens' award shall be given to the Public Sector Undertakings Undertaking Service to the Community Through Activities Under Corporate Social Responsibility and Also Through Programmes for Retired Employees. The activities taken for the benefit of senior citizens should be away from the mainline business of the organization.
benefits: Boarding and lodging expenses covered for awardees and one companion
Traveling expenses reimbursed by the Central Government
eligibility: Best Public Sector Undertaking who have done work in promoting the welfare of senior citizens
Formulating Post-retirement career policy for its employee
Creating infrastructure in geriatric medical care
Providing barrier-free for senior citizens at the workplace
documents_required: Proof of Parent Organisation or Registered Body
Details of the Managing Committee and Qualification of their Members
Annual Reports for the last 3 years

faqs.question: What are the objectives of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to honour the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens.

faqs.question: When are these awards conferred?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred on 1st October every year.

faqs.question: Who confers these awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.

faqs.question: How many categories are there in this award?
faqs.answer: The Awards are given across 13 categories: 07 Institutional Categories and 06 categories of individual type.

faqs.question: Can I nominate myself for this award?
faqs.answer: No, Self-nominations for the Awards shall not be considered.
